title: If individual biology does not change much, what are some pressures to it through the history’s ages? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Individual biology” is not really a useful or practical concept, since biology applies to species, not individuals. Biology affects an individual, because it is part of a certain species. Meaning the biology of any individual conforms to that of the species to which it belongs. Or, in short, the question doesn’t really make sense. also because ‘changes through the ages’’ affecting a species’s biology must be measured in millions rather than thousands of years. In that perspective ‘individual biology’ loses all meaning.
